channel.title: Need advice
channel.description: I wanna switch to ubuntu, but when i tried last it did not work, my wifi card is a broadcom 4318 or sumthin, one of the worst for ubuntu. i will not switch from windows until i have internet, so can anyone tell me how to get my card working, and get a visual network selector like the windows 1

item.title: Need advice
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:22, topic:87937”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=128776.msg1295241#msg1295241 date=1178845845]

dual boot…? hmm well i dont use adobe, only image editing i do can be done in paint or ms photoed, might add htat i cannot find that program nemore… well i dont know if i would really need it, jsut would be usefull

GIMP is far superior to any microsoft image editing program, so just use that.

I’ll see about that when I start using it properly. I highly doubt it is
[/quote]

How can it not be better than paint? Does Microsoft make any other image editing programs?[/quote]

Sorry, just re-read I thought you meant Adobe Photoshop.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

[quote=“Hiaburi, post:11, topic:87937”]/etc/modules followed by a carriage return
idk what a carriage return is, and idk what /etc/modules is

also, my friend had a linux that had sum stuff so it could run windows programs, can you tell me how to do this so if i do get switched over, i can still run my windows programs?[/quote]

The program your friend has is called Wine. Remember though, Linux wasn’t built for Windows programs, and there will be some faults in some of the programs you run with Wine. I don’t believe any Adobe products work with Wine. GIMP is ready installed as you may already know.

That’s why it’s best to be able to dual boot.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Hiaburi, post:11, topic:87937”]/etc/modules followed by a carriage return
idk what a carriage return is, and idk what /etc/modules is

also, my friend had a linux that had sum stuff so it could run windows programs, can you tell me how to do this so if i do get switched over, i can still run my windows programs?[/quote]

/etc/modules is a text file, a carriage return is just a new line (press the enter button)

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Hiaburi:

i already have a card, and my family is poor as fick, so i dont wanna waste ne money, im 17 and most i ever had was 200$…so i had to run sudo modprobe nidwrapper to make it work?? i just realized that i dont htink i ran that one, would that be the problem?

You have to do a lot more than just typing that in to the terminal.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Trying to install something on Ubuntu that isn’t compatible with Linux for your first time is annoying.

ndiswrapper is a bitch at first, but just keep trying and follow the tutorial exactly.

IMO, pull out $20 for a Linux compatible wireless USB card.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:7, topic:87937”]If I recall, you need to use

sudo modprobe nidwrapper

Every time you start up for ndiswrapper to work, well, for me at least. :P[/quote]

Not if you put “ndiswrapper” at the bottom of /etc/modules followed by a carriage return.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

If I recall, you need to use

sudo modprobe nidwrapper

Every time you start up for ndiswrapper to work, well, for me at least.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Hiaburi:

hmm im using 6.10 i think, and yea i got it to recognize my card and stuff but my card stayed off, could not get it to turn on at all. so until i can get it to turn on, im stuck on windows

That is because the driver that comes with ubuntu doesn’t work, you have to use ndiswrapper and your windows driver and it will turn on and work fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Hiaburi:

I wanna switch to ubuntu, but when i tried last it did not work, my wifi card is a broadcom 4318 or sumthin, one of the worst for ubuntu. i will not switch from windows until i have internet, so can anyone tell me how to get my card working, and get a visual network selector like the windows 1

I have the EXACT same card in my laptop, I will find you the article I used that worked perfectly.

edit:

http://kubuntuforums.net/forums/index.php?topic=10383.new

Make sure you follow it step by step, I have used it on two different laptops and it works with at least 6.10 and 7.04, have fun. ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice

item.description:
@MybBob wrote:

I would just recomend using your ethernet, I use Xubuntu, and I just couldn’t face the prospect of setting up my wireless ( Becuz I’m lazy ) So I just unplug my ethernet from main computer <3
